docs.title: Education Platforms
docs.text:
TryHackMe - CTFs and educational rooms with machines to hack into.

HackTheBox - Similar to TryHackMe.

LetsDefend - Hands on SoC analyst training

OverTheWire - "Wargames" - practical security challenges

Codewars - Coding challenges for various languages

CryptoHack - Cryptography challenges; focus on Python scripting

OSINT Dojo - OSINT challenges

CryptoPals - Cryptography challenges

MysteryTwister - Cryptography challenges

docs.title: Hashes
docs.text:
• Haiti - identify hashes, tell you the hashcat/john mode to use

    • Install with gem install haiti-hash

  • Search That Hash - identify hashes and attempt to crack them

  • Hashcat

  • John the Ripper

docs.title: Email
docs.text:
• theHarvester - Find e-mails, subdomains, and names
  • Hunter.io - Find e-mails for a certain domain

docs.title: Facial Recognition
docs.text: • PimEyes - Input an image of a face, receive likely matches

docs.title: Generating Wordlists
docs.text:
• Mentalist - given a list, creates variations of it (i.e. hello -> h3ll0)
  • CeWL - grab words from a URL     - e.g. download all words from example.org with a depth of 2: cewl -d 2 -w $(pwd)/example.txt https://example.org
  • TTPassGen     - e.g. create wordlist containing all combinations of 4 digits ttpassgen --rule '[?d]{4:4:*}' out.txt     - all lowercase character combinations of length 1 - 3 ttpassgen --rule '[?l]{1:3:*}' out.txt     - combination of the above: ttpassgen --dictlist 'pin.txt,abc.txt' --rule '$0[-]{1}$1' combination.txt
